head.title: A Stork Club Reminiscence Brings Out the Memories

hedline.hl1: A Stork Club Reminiscence Brings Out the Memories

abstract.p: William Peterson letter on Patricia Bosworth's April 30 article recalls visits to New York City's Stork Club (S)

block.p: Patricia Bosworth's insider remembrances brought back my own memories. I was back from Korea and occasionally took a date to the Stork. The bar was small, almost intimate and the drinks relatively inexpensive. I would bring a date, we would have two drinks at the bar, invariably Sherman Billingsley would come by and say hello, and we never left without a gift. I wish I still had the great-looking Stork Club tie I got at one visit. The Stork Club despite its image, was friendly, relaxed and a great place to impress a lady. There's nothing like it now.

Patricia Bosworth's insider remembrances brought back my own memories. I was back from Korea and occasionally took a date to the Stork. The bar was small, almost intimate and the drinks relatively inexpensive. I would bring a date, we would have two drinks at the bar, invariably Sherman Billingsley would come by and say hello, and we never left without a gift. I wish I still had the great-looking Stork Club tie I got at one visit. The Stork Club despite its image, was friendly, relaxed and a great place to impress a lady. There's nothing like it now.
Another great joint was Toots Shor's. And then there was Lindy's, the coldest beer and best roast beef I ever tasted.
